info.title: A2A Web UI Backend
info.description: Backend API and SSE server for the A2A Web UI, hosted by Solace AI Connector.

get.description: Basic health check endpoint.
Search sessions by name/title only.

parameters.name: query

schema.description: Search query
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: Search query

delete.description: Soft delete a session (marks as deleted without removing from database).

post.description:
Save a complete task interaction (upsert).
Creates a new task or updates an existing one.

get.description:
Get all tasks for a session.
Returns tasks in chronological order.

Get session message history.
Loads from chat_tasks and flattens message_bubbles for backward compatibility.

patch.description:
Move a session to a different project or remove from project.
When moving to a project, artifacts from that project are immediately copied to the session.

schema.title: Response Get Current User Endpoint Api V1 Users Me Get

get.description:
Check if the current user has access to a list of scopes.

Args:
    scopes: Comma-separated list of scopes to check (e.g., "sam:agent_builder:read,sam:connectors:read")
    user_config: User configuration resolved from dependencies
    config_resolver: ConfigResolver instance for checking scope access

Returns:
    Dictionary with "capabilities" key containing a mapping of each scope to its access status (true/false)

parameters.name: scopes

schema.description: Comma-separated list of scopes to check
schema.title: Scopes

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of scopes to check

schema.title: Response Get User Capabilities Api V1 Users Me Capabilities Get

get.description: Provides configuration settings needed by the frontend application.

schema.title: Response Get App Config Api V1 Config Get

get.description:
Returns version information for all installed SAM products and dependencies.

Detects and returns information only for products that are actually installed.

Retrieves a list of discovered A2A agents filtered by user permissions.

Agents are filtered based on the user's agent:*:delegate scopes to ensure
users only see agents they have permission to access.

schema.title: Response Get Discovered Agent Cards Api V1 Agentcards Get

get.description:
Get the current status of a task.
Used by frontend to check if a background task is still running.

Args:
    task_id: The task ID to query
    
Returns:
    Task status information including whether it's running and can be reconnected to

Get all active background tasks for a user.
Used by frontend on session load to detect running background tasks.

Args:
    user_id: The user ID to filter by
    
Returns:
    List of active background tasks

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: User ID to filter tasks
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: User ID to filter tasks

get.description:
Lists and filters historical tasks by date.
- Regular users can only view their own tasks.
- Users with the 'tasks:read:all' scope can view any user's tasks by providing `query_user_id`.

schema.title: Response Search Tasks Api V1 Tasks Get

get.description:
Retrieves the complete event history for a task and all its child tasks as JSON.
Returns events in the same format as the SSE stream for workflow visualization.
Recursively loads all descendant tasks to enable full workflow rendering.
Retrieves the complete event history for a task and all its child tasks, returning it as a `.stim` file.

post.description:
Submits a non-streaming task request to the specified agent.
Accepts application/json.

Submits a streaming task request to the specified agent.
Accepts application/json.
The client should subsequently connect to the SSE endpoint using the returned taskId.

Sends a cancellation request for a specific task to the specified agent.
Returns 202 Accepted, as cancellation is asynchronous.
Returns 404 if the task context is not found.

get.description:
Establishes an SSE connection to receive real-time updates for a specific task.

Args:
    task_id: The task to monitor
    reconnect: If true, replay missed events before streaming live
    last_event_timestamp: Timestamp of last received event (for replay)

schema.description: Whether this is a reconnection attempt

parameters.description: Whether this is a reconnection attempt

parameters.name: last_event_timestamp

schema.description: Timestamp of last received event for replay
schema.title: Last Event Timestamp

parameters.description: Timestamp of last received event for replay

get.description: Resolves a formal artifact:// URI and streams its content. This endpoint is secure and validates that the requesting user is authorized to access the specified artifact.

post.description: Initiates a new A2A message visualization stream using abstract targets.

get.description: Establishes an SSE connection for receiving filtered A2A messages for a specific stream.

put.description: Modifies the configuration of an active visualization stream.

get.description: Searches for users to populate frontend autocomplete suggestions (e.g., for @mentions).

parameters.name: q

schema.description: Search query for user name/email.
schema.title: Q

parameters.description: Search query for user name/email.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

get.description: Initiates the login flow by redirecting to the external authorization service.
Generates and returns a CSRF token, setting it as a readable cookie and returning it in the response.
Handles the callback from the OIDC provider by calling an external exchange service.

post.description:
Logout endpoint - clears server-side session and access token.

This endpoint:
- Clears the access_token from the session storage
- Clears all session data
- Returns success even if already logged out (idempotent)

The session cookie will be invalidated, requiring re-authentication
on the next request.
Refreshes an access token using the external authorization service.

get.description: Handles OAuth2 authorization code grant response for tool authentication.

post.description: Create a new project for the authenticated user.

get.description:
Get all projects owned by the authenticated user.

Args:
    include_artifact_count: If True, includes artifact count for each project
Get a specific project by ID.

delete.description: Soft delete a project (marks as deleted without removing from database).

get.description: Get all artifacts for a specific project.

schema.title: Response Get Project Artifacts Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Artifacts Get

post.description: Add one or more artifacts to a project.

patch.description: Update metadata (description) for a project artifact.

delete.description: Delete an artifact from a project.

get.description:
Export project as ZIP containing:
- project.json (metadata)
- artifacts/ (all project files)

Excludes: chat history, sessions

post.description:
Import project from ZIP file.
Handles name conflicts automatically.

get.description:
Retrieves feedback with flexible filtering and security controls.

Regular users can only view their own feedback.
Users with the 'feedback:read:all' scope can view any user's feedback.

Query Parameters:
- start_date: Filter feedback created after this date (ISO 8601 format)
- end_date: Filter feedback created before this date (ISO 8601 format)
- task_id: Filter by specific task ID
- session_id: Filter by specific session ID
- rating: Filter by rating type ("up" or "down")
- page: Page number (default: 1)
- page_size: Results per page (default: 20)
- query_user_id: (Admin only) Query feedback for a specific user

schema.title: Response Get Feedback Api V1 Feedback Get

post.description: Receives and processes user feedback for a specific task.

get.description:
Get all prompt groups for quick access (used by "/" command).
Returns all groups owned by user or shared with them.

schema.title: Response Get All Prompt Groups Api V1 Prompts Groups All Get

get.description:
List all prompt groups accessible to the user (owned or shared).
Supports pagination, category filtering, and text search.

post.description:
Create a new prompt group with an initial prompt.
The initial prompt is automatically set as the production version.

get.description: Get a specific prompt group by ID (requires read permission).

patch.description: Update a prompt group's metadata (requires write permission - owner or editor only).

delete.description: Delete a prompt group and all its prompts (requires delete permission - owner or editor only).

patch.description: Toggle pin status for a prompt group (requires write permission).

get.description: List all prompt versions in a group (requires read permission).

schema.title: Response List Prompts In Group Api V1 Prompts Groups  Group Id  Prompts Get

post.description: Create a new prompt version in a group (requires write permission).

patch.description: Update an existing prompt's content (requires write permission).

delete.description: Delete a specific prompt version (requires delete permission).

patch.description: Set a prompt as the production version for its group (requires write permission).

get.description: Initialize the prompt template builder chat

post.description:
Handle conversational prompt template building using LLM.

Uses LLM to:
1. Analyze user's description or example transcript
2. Identify variable elements vs fixed instructions
3. Generate template structure
4. Suggest variable names and descriptions
5. Avoid command conflicts with existing prompts

get.description:
Export a prompt group's active/production version as a JSON file.
Returns a downloadable JSON file containing the prompt data.
Requires read permission on the prompt group.

post.description:
Import a prompt from exported JSON data.
Creates a new prompt group with the imported data.
Handles command conflicts automatically by generating alternative commands.

Transcribe audio to text using configured STT service.

Args:
    audio: Audio file (wav, mp3, webm, ogg)
    provider: Optional provider override (openai, azure)
    language: Optional language code (e.g., "en-US", "es-ES")
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    JSON with transcribed text:
    {
        "text": "transcribed text",
        "language": "en",
        "duration": 5.2
    }

Raises:
    HTTPException: If transcription fails

Convert text to speech using configured TTS service.

Args:
    request: TTS request with text and voice
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    Audio data as MP3

Raises:
    HTTPException: If generation fails

Stream TTS audio for long text (>4096 chars).
Uses chunking and streaming for better UX.

Args:
    request: Stream TTS request with text and voice
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    Streaming audio response

Raises:
    HTTPException: If generation fails

get.description:
Get available TTS voices based on configuration and provider.

Args:
    provider: Optional provider filter (azure, gemini)
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    JSON with available voices:
    {
        "voices": ["Kore", "Puck", "Zephyr", ...],
        "default": "Kore"
    }

Get speech configuration for frontend initialization.

Args:
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    JSON with speech configuration:
    {
        "sttExternal": true,
        "ttsExternal": true,
        "speechToText": true,
        "textToSpeech": true,
        "engineSTT": "external",
        "engineTTS": "external",
        "voice": "Kore",
        "playbackRate": 1.0,
        "cacheTTS": true,
        ...
    }

post.description:
Generate a sample audio for a specific voice to preview before selection.

Args:
    voice: Voice name to sample
    provider: Optional provider (azure, gemini)
    user: Current authenticated user
    audio_service: Audio service instance

Returns:
    Audio data as MP3

Raises:
    HTTPException: If generation fails

The AgentCard is a self-describing manifest for an agent. It provides essential
metadata including the agent's identity, capabilities, skills, supported
communication methods, and security requirements.

AgentCardSignature represents a JWS signature of an AgentCard.
This follows the JSON format of an RFC 7515 JSON Web Signature (JWS).

Declares a combination of a target URL and a transport protocol for interacting with the agent.
This allows agents to expose the same functionality over multiple transport mechanisms.
